message.content:
cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.LG

The paper deals with the problem of layout synthesis, which involves arranging objects in a space while respecting aesthetic and functional constraints. This problem is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including computer graphics (cs.GR), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), social and information networks (cs.SI), and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper's focus on physics-based optimization suggests that it may be more relevant to the first two categories, but the use of optimization techniques and the emphasis on scalability and efficiency make it relevant to the other categories as well.
